name: create-electron-vite
description: Boilerplate for Electron, agnostic to package manager, to start applications based on Vue, React or "vanilla" typescript. React template is delivered with SCSS, Vue and vanilla with regular CSS.
usage: npm create electron-vite@latest projectName

name: vitawind
description: A scaffolding for projects with tailwindcss v3. Agnostic to the package manager. Has the templates with Vite for Vue and React (javascript and typescript), also supports create-react-app and Angular CLI.

name: create-vite
description:
Default scaffolder for Vite. List of currently support templates: vanilla, vanilla-ts, vue, vue-ts, react, react-ts, react-swc, react-swc-ts, preact, preact-ts, lit, lit-ts, svelte, svelte-ts.
Also support community templates via degit.
usage: npm create vite@latest my-vue-app -- --template {template}

name: create-vite-app
description:
Flexible and beautiful interactive CLI which allows to choose and switch a lot of packages and templates. It also includes a bunch of optional plugins to support JSX, legacy browser, PWA, to visualize rollup plugins and others. 
Be ready to cross over comments and untranslated phrases in Chinese.
usage: npx create-vite-template@latest

name: nx
description:
Nx is a powerful open-source build system with first class monorepo support that provides tools and techniques for enhancing developer productivity, optimizing CI performance, and maintaining code quality.

Nx includes a feature of a code generation with a looot of options via plugins. It may support even .Net!
usage: npx create-nx-workspace@latest

name: vite-reactts-eslint-prettier
description: Vite + React + Typescript + Eslint + Prettier
usage:
npx degit TheSwordBreaker/vite-reactts-eslint-prettier project-name
cd project-name
yarn install
yarn dev

name: vitamin
description: Opinionated Vite starter template. Includes Tailwind CSS v3 with a basic reset for form styles and Prettier plugin to sort classes, unit and e2e testing, PWA, GitHub actions and deploy to vercel.com.
usage:
npx degit wtchnm/Vitamin#main my-app
cd my-app
pnpm install

name: react-vite-admin
description:
This Starter utilizes React, Recoil, React Query, React Hooks, Typescript, Axios And Vite.
It seems pretty raw, contains example with an unused code and packages.
usage:
git clone https://github.com/ychengcloud/react-vite-admin.git
 cd react-vite-admin
 yarn install

name: vite-template-react
description: It really resemble vite default project. Official description: "A Create React App-like template."
usage:
git clone https://github.com/SafdarJamal/vite-template-react.git
cd vite-template-react
rm -rf .git && git init && npm init
git add .
git commit -m commit-name
npm i
npm start

name: vitejs-template-react-rescript
description: Integrating ReScript and rescript-react into the official Vite React template
usage:
npx degit jihchi/vitejs-template-react-rescript my-vitejs-react-rescript
cd my-vitejs-react-rescript
npm i
npm start

name: template-vite-react
description: A minimal React Vite starter template. Includes HTTPS support for local development (vite-plugin-mkcert is used).
usage:
npx degit lzm0x219/template-vite-react myapp
cd myapp
git init

name: reactjs-vite-tailwindcss-boilerplate
description: This is a boilerplate build with Vite, React 18, TypeScript, Vitest, Testing Library, TailwindCSS 3, Eslint and Prettier.
usage:
npx degit joaopaulomoraes/reactjs-vite-tailwindcss-boilerplate my-app
cd my-app
pnpm install

name: vite-reactts18-chakra-jest-husky
description: This is a React 18 + TypeScript + Chakra UI boilerplate to be built with Vite. It also includes Husky and a pre-commit hook that runs yarn format.
usage:
npx degit The24thDS/vite-reactts18-chakra-jest-husky my-app
cd my-app
git init
yarn install && yarn dev

name: react-ts-vite-template
description: This is a React + TypeScript boilerplate built with Vite.
usage:
npx degit fabien-ml/react-ts-vite-template my-app
cd my-app
git init
npm install

name: vite-reactts-tailwind-rtk-eslint
description: This is a React + TypeScript + Tailwind + RTK + eslint boilerplate built with Vite.
usage:
git clone https://github.com/IsaiaPhiliph/vite-reactts-tailwind-rtk-eslint
cd vite-reactts-tailwind-rtk-eslint
rm -rf .git
git init
npm i
npm run dev

name: vite-react-tailwind-template
description: Vite React Tailwind Template
usage:
git clone https://github.com/Innei/vite-react-tailwind-template my-app
cd my-app
rm -rf .git
git init
pnpm i
pnpm dev

name: tropical
description: Fast, mostly-just-HTML static sites with islands of client-side JS. Read the website for additional information.
usage:
Should be used as template repo, or just:
git clone https://github.com/bensmithett/tropical my-app
rm -rf .git
git init

name: stratival
description: Kickstart your Web Application with React 18, Vite and Tailwind CSS.
usage:
git clone https://github.com/rizkimcitra/stravital
cd stratival
yarn install && yarn dev

name: vite-react-ts-tailwind-firebase-starter
description: Starter using Vite + React + TypeScript + Tailwind with Firebase.
usage: git clone

name: uchihamalolan/vite-react-ts
description:
Drop-in Replacement for CRA but powered by Vite
- Import SVG's directly as React Component via SVGR
- Unit Testing via Jest & React Testing Library
- ESLint Rules & Prettier
- Tailwind
- Absolute imports within src directory
usage: npx degit uchihamalolan/vite-react-ts your-app-name

name: vite-react-ts-ghactions-template
description: This a React 18 + TypeScript + Vitest and React Testing Library + GitHub Actions starter template built with Vite 4.
usage:
npx degit pchmn/vite-react-ts-ghactions-template app_name
cd app_name
pnpm i
pnpm dev

name: vital
description:
Vite with React 18, typescript and tailwind.
Go to Netlify and select your repository, OK along the way, and your App will be live in a minute.
usage:
npx degit jvidalv/vital my-vital-app
cd my-vital-app
yarn

name: template-vite-react-tailwind-v3
description: React 17 + TailwindCSS
usage: git clone

name: template-vite-react-ts-tailwind-v3
description:
template of: vite + react + typescript
tailwindcss: v3.x
usage: git clone

name: vite-react-starter
description:
Opinionated Vite starter template.

An starter template for Vite React 18 projects including a bunch of useful tools and libraries enforcing best practices and autofix on save.

For styling it comes with SASS, Emotion, and TailwindCSS ready to use. Choose your favorite CSS framework and get started. It also includes the @namics/stylelint-bem plugin for BEM style validation.
usage: git clone

name: chrome-extension-boilerplate-react-vite
description: Chrome Extension Boilerplate with React 18 + Vite + TypeScript
usage: <git clone>

name: vite-ant-design-pro
description: Vite Ant Design Pro.
usage:
npm create ant-design-pro@latest
yarn create ant-design-pro
pnpm create ant-design-pro

name: vite-rtk-query
description:
Vite RTK Query temptelte.
This include React+TS with familiar pre-setup tooling
Redux Toolkit, RTK Query, eslint/prettier, Vitest/TS/react-testing-library/MSW, tailwindcss, GitHub Actions CI.
This is the official Vite template(npm init vite@latest myapp -- --template react-ts) and some extended setup.
usage: npx degit laststance/vite-rtk-query myapp

name: vite-react-proste
description: Simple, convenient, out of the box, using vite's react template
usage: Clone this repo, like git clone https://github.com/xyhxx/vite-react-proste.git. In addition, you can click "Use this template" to copy this template to your repositories

name: vite-react-ts-minimal-template
description: A modern minimal Vite + React + TypeScript template with pre-configured ESLint (with Airbnb JS/React rules), Prettier and Git hooks powered by Husky out of the box ðŸ“¦
usage:
npx degit alessandropisu/vite-react-ts-minimal-template my-app
cd my-app
git init
yarn install
yarn dev

name: browser-app-boilerplate
description:
A react ssrðŸš€ project boilerplate with full typescript, vite, eslint, stylelint, husky, lint-staged, commitlint support. NO combined UI library or style library, especially built for those who always want to choose eject and keep things under control.

Production use of this project is possible, but will require advanced refactoring and optimization due to many implementation details.
usage:
git clone https://github.com/EverSeenTOTOTO/browser-app-boilerplate.git my-project -b react-vite-ssr --depth 1
cd my-project
yarn

name: viact
description: Viact is a starter template for React 18 + TypeScript that uses Vitejs, which supports RTL for specific styles, proxy fetching API (to fix CORS errors) and a simple mock REST API server. Additionally, Is set up VScode, Storybook, ErrorBoundary, UnoCss (atomic CSS engine), Eslint, Prettier, and more.
usage:
git clone https://github.com/MR-Mostafa/Viact.git
cd Viact
yarn install
yarn run reset

name: viterts
description: Viterts. Opinionated template
usage:
npx degit erdoganbulut/viterts my-viterts-app
cd my-viterts-app
yarn # If you don't have yarn installed, run: npm install -g yarn

name: viterc
description: A minimal Vite + React + TypeScript template with pre-configured ESLint (with Airbnb JS/React rules), Prettier, Testing with Jest and Git hooks with Husky out of the box
usage:
npx degit potreco/viterc my-app
cd my-app
git init
yarn install
yarn dev

name: vrttv
description:
Are you tired of always creating the same structure from scratch for your projects? Me too.

This is my go-to when I start a new project on front-end development.

If you found it useful somehow, I would be grateful if you could leave a star in the project's GitHub repository
usage: npx degit Drumpy/vrttv-boilerplate your-folder-name

name: react-pwa
description: This project (a GitHub template) is an opinionated setup for modern web applications built on React 18. It's a combination of essential (and minimal) libraries/components/utils/etc., which developers usually need during the process of making modern React applications.
usage: <git clone> or use as template
